results.title: The Director
results.brief_description: Director Don Weis bears the responsibility of supervising every aspect of putting a film together. His talent must encompass acting, camera work, special effects, music, costumes, make-up, scripts, editing and budgeting. This film places the viewer beside a skilful director as he gives shape to a major Hollywood production. Features Robert Wagner in acting role.

results.title: The Diplomat
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, SBS Independent, Emerald Films, Sally Browning, Wilson Da Silva and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: For 24 years East Timor’s freedom fighter and Nobel Peace Prize winner Jose Ramos Horta campaigned to secure independence for his country, a former Portuguese colony invaded by Indonesia in 1975. This documentary follows him through the final year of East Timor’s struggle, a year that saw the fall of Indonesia’s President Suharto, the referendum to determine East Timor’s future, the overwhelming vote for independence, the devastating carnage that ensued, the subsequent intervention of United Nations peacekeepers, and Ramos Horta’s final triumphant return to his homeland. He emerges as a tenacious and beguiling character whose roles as a diplomat and peacemaker was a crucial one that helped finally deliver his country its freedom.

results.title: The Diploma Disease (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Institute of Development Studies, Angela Little and Ron Dore
results.brief_description: Educational credentials are increasingly required by employees and so education gives way to ritualised preparation for exams. The ideals of education are powerless against the pressure on schools in societies which have caught the “diploma disease”. Examines symptoms in Japan, Mexico, Sri Lanka, and Britain

results.title: The Diode: principles and applications
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of electron flow across a gap, basic features of the diode tube, control of the electron flow in the tube, photoelectric cells, x-ray tubes, and the diode as a rectifier.

results.title: The Dinosaur age
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Describes the work of two palaeontologists looking for fossils on a rocky hillside. They uncover the paddle or flipper of a plesiosaur which was a large water living reptile or sea serpent closely related to dinosaurs. The methods used to uncover the bones, preserve them, and transport them to a museum are shown, also the tedious work of assembling the bones, fitting them in position and reconstructing the entire animals are explained. Models of representative animals of the age of dinosaurs are shown.

results.title: The Dinner game = Le Diner de cons
results.creator_credit: Alain Poire, Sharmill Films and Francis Veber
results.brief_description: Pierre Brochant (Thierry Lhermitte), a wealthy publisher, yuppie and art collector is into competitions of a completely different nature. The challenge between he and his friends is to bring an “idiot” to their regular Wednesday dinner, for an evening of culinary delights and amusing conversation at the cost of these supposedly intellectually inferior diners. Pierre’s friend thinks he is onto a winner with a boomerang salesman; Pierre thinks he is in with a good chance with Finance Ministry accountant, Francois Pignon (Jacques Villeret), a matchstick construction enthusiast. The viewer is never privy to seeing one of these dinner farces in action, instead Pierre finds himself spending time in his apartment with Francois, who kindly offers to help his new friend whose wife has just left him, and who is also now incapacitated by an injured back courtesy of a dodgy golf swing. In the space of a few short hours Pierre has a dinner party for two, with he being the sole witness to Francois’ stupidity and bearing the brunt of his actions as meddling with “idiots” moves into a different realm. Cast also includes Francis Huster, Alexandra Vandernoot and Daniel Prevost. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dingles (K)
results.creator_credit: Bill Pettigrew, ONF | NFB and Les Drew
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Helen Levchuk, this animated short children’s film is the story of Doris Dingle and her three cat - Donna, Dayoh and Deedee - and their adventure one windy and rainy day. A funny and visually delightful for children aged three to ten and their parents. Illustrated by John Bianchi. (Awards: Chicago; San Francisco; New York) Also available on DVD [319319].

results.title: The Diminishing rain forest
results.creator_credit: Robert Horne, Ken Taylor and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Shows the wildlife in an Australian tropical forest and how it survives natural devastation but not the influence of man. Contains footage of John Olsen paintings. Commentary by Douglas Dorward.
